alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Hamilton; Marion; McMinn; Sequatchie; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 6:27AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bradley, southeastern Sequatchie, southwestern Polk, southwestern McMinn, eastern Marion and Hamilton Counties through 815 AM EDT/715 AM CDT/... At 726 AM EDT/626 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harrison, or 10 miles east of Chattanooga, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Dunlap, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Rossville, Walden, Lakesite, Charleston and Ridgeside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradley; Hamilton; Marion; McMinn; Sequatchie; West Polk
